subject: World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: Reinfried Herbst led an Austrian 1-2 finish in a World Cup night slalom in Schladming, Austria, and Bode Miller finished eighth. Herbst, who led after the opening leg, won in a combined time of 1 minute 37.32 seconds. He beat Manfred Pranger by 1.16 seconds for his second victory of the season and fifth over all. Ivica Kostelic of Croatia was third and extended his lead in the overall standings. Miller, the defending overall champion, finished in 1:39.34. Nine of the 30 racers missed a gate in their second run on the Planai course because of tough conditions after a recent heavy snowfall.
